children.title: Rendering bindable lists
children.markup: First name Last name
children.description: You can create bindable collections using js.bindableList method. BindableList acts like a regular bindable value, but it has a few additional methods. BindableList could be bound to markup element using regular View. In this case, the View will be rendered for every list item.

children.title: List binding interaction
children.description: Demonstrates using add/remove methods of bindable list. Note that you can add or remove multiple items at one call.

children.title: Rendering list size
children.description:
BindableList exposes a count() method that returns the list size object. This object is a BindableValue instance so you can wire it to UI element using regular binding functions: 

js.bind(someList.count()).to("#someListSize")

List count gets updated every time you call one of list methods:

  • setValue
  • add
  • remove
